name: Helen Keller International
mission: Guided by our founder’s remarkable legacy, Helen Keller Intl works to improve the lives of people around the world by protecting vision, enhancing nutri...
theoryOfChange: Helen Keller International utilizes the Essential Nutrition Actions (ENA) framework as an organizing framework for its strategy to improve maternal, infant, and young child nutrition. This framework provides an operational approach for advocacy, planning, training, and delivery of an integrated package of interventions designed to achieve high coverage and public health impact. Furthermore, Helen Keller International has an overarching strategic plan titled 'Leading Locally, Fortifying Futures' which outlines their approach to sustaining core program areas of nutrition, vision, and health, and driving transformation in critical high-impact areas. The organization also emphasizes a strong Monitoring and Evaluation (M&E) system, including a new tool developed to enhance decision-making for Post Event Coverage Surveys (PECS) within their Vitamin A Supplementation (VAS) programs. Their commitment to accountability and transparency is also demonstrated through a framework of policies, procedures, and practices.

zakatClaimEvidence: Organization is in zakat denylist (partners but doesn't collect directly)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.evidence: Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Strong humanitarian service (+4)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or regions with limited nonprofit coverage
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 37/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, global health cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: Document why reserves above your policy target are intentional (e.g., restrictions, volatility, planned commitments) and define deployment triggers.
components.name: Financial Health

score_details.score_summary: Helen Keller International shows strong alignment and good impact.

zakat.claim_evidence: Organization is in zakat denylist (partners but doesn't collect directly)

all_citations.claim: The charity holds a 99.5/100 score and focuses on systemic change in global health.
Total revenue reached $145,494,796 with an 82.8% program expense ratio.
The organization manages significant donated medicines and health interventions.
The organization accepts general donations and sadaqah for its vision and nutrition programs.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: With an overall score of 70/100, the organization demonstrates high financial accountability and strong alignment with global health priorities, though its systemic impact model results in a moderate impact score.
areas_for_improvement: High cost per beneficiary for specific systemic change interventions
Opportunity to further diversify funding streams beyond large-scale grants

dimension_explanations.alignment: Scoring 37/50 in alignment, the charity offers a high fit for donors interested in global health and nutrition [1]. Its long-standing track record and status as a sadaqah-eligible organization make it a reliable choice for general charitable giving [8].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization focuses on systemic change in global health, which is reflected in its 33/50 impact score [1]. While it maintains an 82.8% program expense ratio, the complex nature of its health and vision programs results in a calculated cost per beneficiary of approximately $2,063.76 [2][7].

baseline_narrative.headline: Helen Keller International transforms lives by preventing blindness and reducing malnutrition through evidence-based health interventions across the globe.
strengths: Exceptional financial efficiency with a fundraising cost of only $0.03 per $1 raised
Strong program commitment with an 82.8% program expense ratio
Robust liquidity with 18.6 months of working capital available
baseline_narrative.summary: Guided by the legacy of its founder, Helen Keller International works to protect vision and enhance nutrition for vulnerable populations through its US Vision Program and global health initiatives [1][8]. The organization operates with a high level of transparency, maintaining a Charity Navigator score of 99.5/100 and managing total revenue of $145,494,796 [1][2].
